title: (06800) Mérida - 1A Calle Hoy Diario de Extrem 75
title_short: (06800) Mérida - 1A Calle Hoy Diario de Extrem 75
description:
OK first and foremost this is a great Aire. The community are providing an excellent place to park and an easy walk to the town and it’s amazing sights.

That said the booking system is awful. This is in part due to the fact the Aire is free at the moment and there is an incentive to book for three days even if you only stay one or two. This means there are unoccupied spaces that are showing up as occupied. 

It will bed down. When you check in only use the amount of days you require. Plus electricity can only be booked for two days. 

The shower ticket essentially is for the water, as both are unlocked. Again this is free at the moment an will give 15 min of hot and cold water. 

They will start charging in 2024 and perhaps it will get better.

title: (06800) Mérida - 2 Calle Cabo Verde
description: The Roman Theater car park is now one of the most modern car parks in Mérida. It is equipped with the latest technological devices for safety, accessibility and comfort. It had a new and innovative image for its time and was close to all the monuments of the historic center of Mérida. a remarkable fact in another parking lot. Right next to the Roman Circus and Casa del Mitreo and 5 minutes walk from the Roman Theater and Amphitheater, it should be noted that within a 10-minute walk you can reach everything in the historic center: Aqueduct of Miracles, Temple of Diana , Roman Bridge, etc. Directly next to an indoor pool you can swim for a daily fee. Restaurants and shops in the area. It's not just a Womo parking lot, this space is also used by a whole squadron of buses. I wasn't allowed to drive in in the late afternoon, everything was full of buses and cars, the Womos were so narrow I wouldn't be there FREE STAY ??

title: (06009) Badajoz - Km 2. 1 Carretera de Sevilla
description:
Motorhome rest area located in a gas station 2 kilometers from Badajoz, leveled and fenced for the safety of children and pets
It has 20 seats, a store at the gas station where they have bread, coffee (mini super) with special discounts for caravans. It also has special discounts on fuel for caravanists.
It has a picnic area where you can use chairs, tables, awnings etc ...
The maximum parking is 72/96 hours, the area for filling and emptying sewage is far from the camping area, just behind the store.
It also has gray water emptying in the grid of the open laundry box
It has a laundry room for caravans with promotions and discounts.
It has a sale of candies.

title: (06010) Dehesilla de Calamón - 15 Dehesilla Calamón
description: Park a couple of km from Badajoz, ideal to rest, very quiet area with a shop next door. The parking area has good shade. Inside the park there is a feeding area and exercise machines.

title: (06007) Badajoz - 10 Camino Viejo San Vicente
description:
Recently renovated, for 20 seats
improved with electricity, without leveling and without shadows, on the right bank of the Guadiana river and right next to the Las Palmas bridge (currently only for cyclist pedestrians); garden to one side too. Very nice night view of the bridge. Within walking distance of other banks of the river and therefore the city center. It is usually busy; look for P identified here as an alternative (on the same bank after the bridge).
The maximum parking will be 72/96 hours. It is forbidden to remove any element from the motorhome such as chairs, tables, barbecues, awnings, clothes lines, etc..., since this is considered "camping" and the laws of the Junta de Extremadura expressly prohibit free camping. The area must be kept in a perfect state of cleanliness. When using the filling and emptying terminal, do not spill liquids out of the sink and grid, leaving everything clean. It is forbidden to wash cars or motorhomes in the area Failure to comply with these rules will be penalized.

title: (06004) Badajoz - 11a Calle Rafael Lucenqui

title: (06487) Cordobilla de Lácara - Unnamed Road

title: (06200) Almendralejo - 651 N-630
description: Free water tap, not sure if it's suitable for drinking but we drink bottled water anyways, we fill up our tank for washing.

title: (06840) Alange - BA-V-6111
description: At the end of a stop, facing the immense lake. Beautiful place, a bit far from the road. Some rubbish unfortunately. Few mosquitoes also in this hot month of September.

description: Quiet place, tables benches and trees for shade.

title: (06200) Almendralejo - 12 Calle Francisco de Quevedo

title: (06011) Badajoz - 8 Calle Emigrante Pacense

title: (06011) Badajoz - Km. 2,8 Carretera Olivenza
description: Amalio Gamma - they have butane and propane gas bottles from CEPSA.

title: (06006) Badajoz - 414P Camino Nevero
description: Area to rest, quiet area, there is a gas station nearby and a Mercadona nearby, an area of trees, a grassy area nearby to walk the dog

title: (10199) Cáceres - Camino a Carmonita
description: Magical place like almost everyone here in Extremadura, reserved for 4x4 off-road vehicles because the road is narrow and winding, the game is worth the candle because the peace and the exclusivity of a place require sacrifices

title: (06150) Santa Marta - 7 Calle Principado de Asturies
title_short: (06150) Santa Marta - 7 Calle Principado de Asturies
description: Streets to park next to the fair, at times that do not coincide with the town fair. It is forbidden to park inside the fair area as such.

title: (06840) Alange - EX-105
description: Parking next to the dam with beautiful views. Next to a path for hiking and wall for climbing.

title: (06011) Badajoz - Calle José Miguel Sánchez
description: Sports Las Granadillas. Open every day until 10:45. Showers with hot water. Cloakroom on entering right.

title: (06006) - 31 Urbanizacion Sub
description: A flat place and quite far from the noise of bottles and restaurants on the weekends. There is plenty of room, with very wide squares, and it is quiet. No services, but we found it to be a pretty decent place to rest since the AC area was full and there was a lot of noise in that area.

title: (06006) Badajoz - Paseo Fluvial
description: Surface-hardened sand and stones. On the river. At the Badajoz rowing club. Saturday night noisy from nightclub nearby. ATTENTION: A wide, well-developed asphalt road leads here directly by the river, which strangely enough is not recommended by any navigation system. It is advisable to look for the access road directly at the bridge itself. Otherwise you will be piloted wildly through the area on adventurous paths, and in the end you will not arrive.

title: (06009) Badajoz - s/n Calle Ángel Galván
description: Two small car parks by the river. Only fishermen come. Otherwise a very quiet area next to the canoeing school and with exceptional views.

title: (06006) Badajoz - PK 405 Autovía del Suroeste
description: Special galp area for showering, you have around 8 minutes. Water with good pressure and hot. Highly recommended.

title: (06150) Santa Marta -
description: Area of pine forests, picnic areas, swings on the outskirts of town, very quiet. It parks well and it is possible to spend the night

title: (06192) Villar del Rey - Carretera del Pantano Peña Del Aguila
title_short: (06192) Villar del Rey - Carretera del Pantano Peña Del Aguila

address.street: Carretera del Pantano Peña Del Aguila

address.street: Carretera del Pantano Peña Del Aguila

title: (06830) La Zarza - Paraje Villagonzola
description: Access from BA-156. It is a place of fishing, picnic tables, families spend afternoons there. On Friday and Saturday evenings young people drink there in the evening. We spent a very quiet Sunday night there with the sound of frogs. A tree under which to have shade for small jigs (Iveco Daily goes there). Otherwise a fairly flat concrete platform is not shaded. Thank you for respecting the villagers who clearly have their habits there :)

title: (06840) Alange - 1 Travesía Castillo
description: Location near Lake Alange. Very pleasant calm and free.

title: (06006) Badajoz -
description: A quiet place next to the river. In wild nature. Only some fishermen pass. Ideal to come with dogs. Different types of birds are sighted. Following the path there are more spots to spend the night. Please keep the space clean.

title: (06006) Badajoz - S/N Avenida de Elvas
description: Ample parking space for shopping at the mall, with free water and electricity pole, WiFi in the mall, only one space and there is no gray area to empty.

description: Place of passage For the hours I spent the night there. Quiet place next to the highway. A lot of noise from vehicles passing by the highway. If you get lower the noise is less. As free parking is fine for the night. No water, no gray, no electricity.

title: (06840) Alange - Carretera Palomas
description:
In the town of Alange, overlooking the water reservoir of the same name. Next to the football stadium there is a large free esplanade where you park and spend the night. The town is famous among other things for the Roman baths very close, besides activities in the nature: canoes, trekking, etc. Surrounded by small mountains of great beauty.
Park with water fountain next to the esplanade.

title: (06172) Torre de Miguel Sesmero - 2 Carretera Nogales
title_short: (06172) Torre de Miguel Sesmero - 2 Carretera Nogales

title: (06473) Villagonzalo - Unnamed Road

title: (06840) Alange - BA-005

title: (06840) Alange - BA-005

title: (06893) San Pedro de Mérida - A-5
description: Small unpaved car park just outside the Cornalvo Natural Park. Beautiful walks to do in the area. 0 services and calm guaranteed! Access by unpaved road (well rolling: ok for vans) either from San Pedro de Mérida or from Campomanes. Thank you for keeping this place clean!

name: Camping Rural Os Anjos
title: (7370-214) Camping Rural Os Anjos
description: Small Campsite just outside lovely Campo Maior (1,5 km E) with its supermarkets, restaurants and museums. It is 14 km from the Spanish border Badajoz and 20 km from Elvas. It has a beautiful view. You can do walking and cycling or visit nice towns. Nice atmosphere.

Quiet location next to an abandoned mine. Relatively flat, no blocks needed.
Has great sight over the surrounding area and some hiking tracks nearby.

The road is gravel but well maintained when coming from La Zarza

title: (06510) Alburquerque - Unnamed Road
description: Quiet place in the middle of nature to spend the day people fishing and spending the day in the field we spent two nights and very well.

title: (7370-035) Campo Maior - Avenida Bombeiros Voluntários
description: Long free flat P parallel to avenue, between stadium and firemen station. Quiet enough by night to rest. No facilites.

title: (06173) Nogales - Unnamed Road
description: Cork oak area next to the Nogales reservoir. No tables or bins. Close to the town of Nogales, with a beautiful castle. Bars in the Plaza. Small supermarket next to the school. From the dam, sighting of raptors. We do not know if an overnight stay is allowed.

title: (06006) Badajoz - 9 Diseminado Benavides
description: At the end of the path to the previous spot to be even quieter, it is a nice flat place with pick nick tables from the sun and the shade and on the other side of the river is Portugal :) Accessible to all. Ps. I did not take a photo because I went there by bike.

title: (06510) Alburquerque - EX-110
description: Just off the main road.  You can get about 30 m from the road.  Great for lunch or an overnight stop.

title: (10160) Alcuéscar - EX-382

title: (10160) Alcuéscar - Cordel de Mérida s/n
description: Campsite motorhome. max. number of places: 8 | max. camper length: 8m | max. length of stay: 3 weeks| Open: 1/1 - 31/12. price: - electricity, loading unloading waste water, washing machine, drinking water, wifi available at reception for a fee - call in advance - village 3km - close to the A66 exit 590. approach via the EX382 via Cordel de Mérida, Red gravel road entrance at wood company with yellow fences, after 900 meters on the cordel de Merida motorhome La Tierra Verde Holiday Accommodations

title: (06176) La Parra - 23 Carretera Morera

title: (06390) Feria - 11 Calle Badajoz

title: (06100) Olivenza - Unnamed Road
description: Quiet little corner by the lake, tables and garbage cans available. I spent a day and a night here, no worries.

title: (10160) Alcuéscar - Unnamed Road

title: (06175) Salvatierra de los Barros - EX-320
description: Large picnic area and mirador, set well away from the road, which is not a busy one anyway. Extensive 180 degree views

title: (06175) Salvatierra de los Barros - EX-320
description: Picnic area well away from the road. Quiet at night. Clean. No services. Walking path northwards to view vultures, and south on dirt road through beautiful woodland. Much better than the other mirador picnic area closer to Salvatierra.

title: (06510) Alburquerque - 28 Calle Pozo Concejo
description: Parking next Machaco Hotel at the entrance of the village. There is little space, although there is not much room to park in the villa. In Duque Street, which is next, you can also park early. Although Google Maps appears with the ground, it is really asphalted.

title: (06220) Villafranca de los Barros - N-630
description: Air of rest with trees and quiet table

title: (06510) Alburquerque -
description: Beautiful place on a piece of land between two estates. The dirt road to it is not so pretty, but I thought it was worth it. The area is used for recreation, by shepherds and unfortunately also by people to dump (large) waste. There is therefore some rubble here and there, despite the prohibition signs.

title: (10163) Aldea del Cano - 605 CC-71
description: It is a gas station where you can park and sleep. Much noise from the continuous coming and going of vehicles. There is a 24-hour cafeteria and a shop. It is near a town.

title: (10163) Aldea del Cano - 3 Calle Carretera
description: It has no service. We spent the night very quiet and ate in the bar, by the way we ate very well.

title: (06300) Zafra - Carretera de Córdoba
description: Picnic area next to the road. It has tables with stone benches and wastebaskets. It has the shadow of some pines.

title: (10550) Aliseda - EX-303
description: Parking of the sanctuary of the virgin of the field. Very quiet, with trees and shade. More or less I call. There are bathrooms that are only open when mass is celebrated. On a high.

title: (10195) Cáceres - Camino del Mortero
description: Near the river at the beginning of the sierra. Hiking trails. The descent from the road is not in good condition.
